document.heading: REGIONAL AIRPORTS AUTHORITY AMENDMENT ACT OF 1998

meta.search-text: EN L ENT(S) kwiktag ¯ 062 323 829 ENROLLED ORIGINAL AN ACT D,C, ACT 12-543 IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA DECEMBER ii, 1998 To amend the District of Columbia Regional Airports Authority Act of 1985 to provide the Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority police officers certain powers now possessed by the Commonwealth of Virginia police, update other Virginia Code references, and to clarify that amended versions of the Virginia Code apply to the Authority’s police. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Regional Airports Authority Amendment Act of 1998 Sec. 2. Section 8(b) of the District of Columbia Regional Airports Authority Act of 1985, effective December 3, 1985 (D.C. Law 6-67; 32 DCR 6098 is amended by striking the phrase "Chapter 3 of Title 15.1, Chapter 11 of Title 16.1, Title 18.2, and Title 46.1 of the Code of Virginia" and inserting the phrase "Chapter 17 of Title 15.2, and Chapter 11 of Title 16.1, Title 18.2, Title 19.2, and Title 46.2 of the Code of Virginia as those rifles may be amended from time to time" in its place. Sec. 3. Fiscal impact statement. There shall be no fiscal impact for the implementation of this legislation. This is merely conforming legislation required under the interstate compact between the District and Virginia for the operation of the Ronald Reagan National Airport and the Washington Dulles International Airport. This legislation extends to the Airports Authority’s police officers the same power granted Virginia police officers under 19.2 of the Virginia Code, it updates other Virginia Code references, and clarifies that amended versions of the Virginia Code apply to the Authority’s police. The Commonwealth of Virginia has already enacted similar legislation to expand the Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority’s police officers power. That legislation is scheduled to become effective on July 1, 1998. This legislation is necessary before the legislative changes can be given full effect. ENROLLED ORIGINAL See. 4.
